entry.title: Newsletter #120
entry.content:
Hello everyone, for the first newsletter of 2016, we have the final results from our ping pong (TT) competition. After an intense final match between David and Geshan, the winner is… Geshan!

This is how the tournament unfolded in the past weeks:

And yes here is your weekly dose of links we came across in the first week of 2016! Enjoy!!

  • 100 days practicing tdd

  • addyosmani.com – offline installation of npm packages

  • building for http/2

  • docker has turned us all into sysadmins — packt publishing — medium

  • get started with angular 2 by building a simple website – one hungry mind

  • how can i combine two non-sequential git commits into one? – stack overflow

  • how to be a programmer

  • how to tackle the react ecosystem

  • instant web application | better world by better software

  • internet explorer end of support

  • introducing dumb-init, an init system for docker containers

  • javascript frameworks and mobile performance : tom dale

  • learning javascript (part 1)

  • let’s compose some react containers — kadira voice — medium

  • new symfony tips

  • one world, one language — css perverts

  • one year of web components — medium

  • python moving to github

  • react router’s future — rackt and roll — medium

  • react’s jsx: the other side of the coin — medium

  • recipe-oriented documentation

  • sebastian mckenzie: 2015 in review

  • signs that you’re a good programmer – software engineering tips

  • static sites with docker — ilkka.io

  • tdd your api with symfony and phpunit

  • the command line crash course

  • the composer.json schema – autoload dev

  • the end of dynamic languages

  • the future of bundling javascript modules

  • the future of node is in microsoft’s fork

  • the truth about working at a japanese company – the ruby ronin

  • tiny npm package

  • want to learn javascript in 2015 / 2016? — medium

  • welcome to future of web application delivery — medium

  • what good code is? – carlos alexandro becker

  • why did i write a machine learning book in ruby?

  • writing clear code, not clever code

entry.title: Newsletter #118
entry.content:
Hi there!

Today we will celabrate 4th Namshi’s birthday!

Thanks to all the people at Namshi! We’ll share with you the party pictures next week! ;) In the meanwhile you’ll get some really good links for the weekend!

Enjoy!!

  • 9 javascript apis accessing device hardware

  • a curated list of articles complaining that go (golang) isn’t good enough

  • a new micro clearfix hack – nicolas gallagher

  • announcing ionic 1.2 | the official ionic blog

  • bff @ soundcloud | thoughtworks

  • building for http/2

  • cssconf eu 2015 | una kravets: photoshop is dead!: editing images in css – youtube

  • day 15 – integrating with unit tests – blackfire

  • javascript: the bad parts with john k. paul – software engineering daily

  • node interactive debugging node.js in production

  • outlearn — learn go from scratch — why learn go?

  • public speaking: be comfortable looking like an idiot.

  • sqlpad – a web app for running sql queries and visualizing the results

  • the 7d’s of development what they don’t teach you at code school

  • the first person to hack the iphone built a self-driving car. in his garage

  • they rejected us.

  • uber/ringpop-node

  • why gnu grep is fast

  • why i’m not using your open source project

entry.title: Newsletter #110
entry.content:
Hi There!

This week we got a new ping pong table woo hoo! The guys were happy to try their ping pong skills.

Below you can find the usual list of interesting articles we discovered in the past 7 days.

  • [sydphp] http2 and asynchronous apis // speaker deck

  • amazon inspector – automated security assessment service | aws official blog

  • amazon rds update – mariadb is now available | aws official blog

  • amazon web services to add analytics – wsj

  • containing your logical backups: mydumper in docker

  • css polyfills from the future

  • developing with docker at ifttt

  • easiest way to setup ubuntu as a vpn server – ask ubuntu

  • finding a video poker bug made these guys rich—then vegas made them pay

  • getting started with raygun: insights and crash reporting for app developers – tuts code tutorial

  • how to monitor docker-based applications using new relic – tuts code tutorial

  • how to name things: the hardest problem in programming

  • integrating web components with angularjs · pascal precht

  • json-schema faker

  • linux kernel dev sarah sharp quits, citing ‘brutal’ communications style | network world

  • my first 12 years at amazon.com – jeff barr’s blog

  • no comments allowed on reddit’s new news site ‘upvoted’ | wired

  • not awesome: es6 classes

  • optimizing android bytecode with redex | engineering blog | facebook code

  • programming sucks

  • rasmus lerdorf – speeding up the web with php 7

  • react reflux and how to boost your development workflow // speaker deck

  • refactoring to a happier development team – interview with coraline ada ehmke – fog creek blog

  • remote-first vs. remote-friendly

  • rocket internet expects start-ups to break even soon | reuters

  • runnable documentation: code for humans – github engineering

  • sysdig cloud | announcing microservice-level monitoring for ecs

  • tcp over ip anycast – pipe dream or reality? | linkedin engineering

  • testing required, tdd optional | stitch fix technology – multithreaded

  • the debate around “do we even need css anymore?” | css-tricks

  • the debate around “do we even need css anymore?” | css-tricks

  • understanding css: selector specificity — medium
